item.title: 好时第一季度业绩超出预期，原因是定价提高
item.description: 受惠于价格上涨和消费者对巧克力和糖果的稳定需求，好时公司周五公布的第一季度销售额和利润超出华尔街预期。【原文：Hershey exceeded Wall Street expectations for first-quarter sales and profit on Friday, benefiting from higher prices and steady consumer demand for its chocolates and candy.】

item.title: 创纪录的回购和销售增长预期吸引投资者，苹果股价大涨
item.description: 周五收盘前，苹果公司股价大涨近 6%，原因是这家 iPhone 制造商创纪录的股票回购计划和销售增长承诺吸引了因担心需求疲软和中国市场竞争加剧而回避该股的投资者。【原文：Apple shares jumped nearly 6% before the bell on Friday as the iPhone maker's record stock buyback plan and promise of sales growth drew back investors who have shunned the stock on concerns over weak demand and increased competition in China.】

item.title: 高盛就 2014 年与金属交易有关的集体诉讼达成和解
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）周五表示，该公司已达成原则性和解，以解决 2014 年与铂金和钯金交易有关的集体诉讼。【原文：Goldman Sachs said on Friday it had reached an in-principle settlement to resolve a 2014 class action lawsuit related to trading in platinum and palladium.】

item.title: 竞争对手安进公司预告减肥药数据后，诺和诺德下跌 5
item.description: 丹麦制药商诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk）的股价周五最高下跌了5.3%，创下自2022年8月以来的最大单日跌幅，此前竞争对手安进公司（Amgen）表示，其肥胖症实验药物的中期试验数据令其感到鼓舞。【原文：Shares in Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk dropped as much as 5.3% on Friday, set for their biggest one-day fall since August 2022, after rival Amgen said it was encouraged by interim trial data on its experimental obesity drug.】

item.title: 优步、Lyft 临时工的地位取决于马萨诸塞州法庭之争
item.description: 在美国，Uber 和 Lyft 的共享单车司机应被视为独立承包商，还是有权享受福利和工资保护的雇员，马萨诸塞州已成为这场长达数年争斗的最新阵地。【原文：Massachusetts has become the latest front in a years-long battle in the United States over whether ride-share drivers for Uber and Lyft should be treated as independent contractors or employees entitled to benefits and wage protections.】

item.title: 沃伦-巴菲特的 PacifiCorp 公用事业公司被野火烧毁
item.description: 两年前，沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）将伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）的能源业务称为其企业集团的四大 "巨头 "之一。现在，他担心该公司的商业模式可能会被打破。【原文：Two years ago, Warren Buffett branded Berkshire Hathaway's energy business one of his conglomerate's four "giants." Now he fears its business model may be broken.】

item.title: 苹果和安进公司提振期指上涨；就业数据即将公布
item.description: 周五，美国股指期货上涨，受苹果公司和安进公司（Amgen）乐观的企业动态提振，而交易商则在等待一份关键的就业报告，以便对劳动力市场和利率路径有更清晰的展望。【原文：U.S. stock index futures gained on Friday, lifted by upbeat corporate updates from Apple and Amgen, while traders braced for a key jobs report for a clearer outlook on the labor market and the interest rate path.】

item.title: 谷歌在美国反垄断审判中面临第二天的结案陈词
item.description: 美国政府将在周五对 Alphabet 旗下谷歌公司的反垄断案件进行第二日的结案陈词，重点是指控这家在线搜索行业的领军企业为保持搜索广告的领先地位而违法。【原文：The U.S. government will lay out its antitrust case against Alphabet's Google on Friday in a second day of closing arguments focused on accusations that the online search leader broke the law to stay on top in search advertising.】

item.title: 伯克希尔哈撒韦公司股东大会：沃伦-巴菲特将占据中心舞台
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）将在周六举行的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）年会上占据中心位置，但有一个人不会出席，那就是他极具影响力的助手查理-芒格（Charlie Munger）。【原文：Warren Buffett will command center stage at Berkshire Hathaway's annual meeting on Saturday, but someone who won't be there -- his influential sidekick Charlie Munger -- will loom large.】

item.title: 加拿大液化天然气终端启动后，美国将失去加拿大天然气
item.description: 公司表示，加拿大首个液化天然气（LNG）出口终端的启动很可能会使其天然气供应在数年内处于紧张状态，并迫使生产商减少对美国的出口，而美国对这种燃料的需求正创下历史新高。【原文：The start-up of LNG Canada, the country's first such export terminal, is likely to strain its natural gas supplies for multiple years and force producers to reduce exports to the U.S., where demand for the fuel is record high, companies said.】

item.title: 早间竞价乔布斯测试美联储宽松政策，苹果回购潮
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 主要央行在四月徘徊于不安的平静之中
item.description: 4 月份，由于美国联邦储备委员会（U.S. Federal Reserve）利率长期走高的前景给政策制定者带来了一定的压力，特别是在新兴市场，印尼出人意料地上调了利率，因此主要央行的利率保持不变。【原文：Interest rates at major central banks remained static in April as the prospect of higher-for-longer U.S. Federal Reserve rates exerted some pressure on policymakers, especially in emerging markets, where Indonesia delivered a surprise hike.】

item.title: 安进公司预告 "令人鼓舞 "的减肥数据后股价大涨
item.description: 美国制药商安进公司周五盘前股价大涨13%至316.26美元，该公司预告其肥胖症实验药物将获得令人鼓舞的数据，点燃了投资者的希望，但华尔街却对缺乏细节感到沮丧。【原文：U.S. drugmaker Amgen's shares jumped 13% to $316.26 premarket on Friday as the company teased encouraging data for its experimental obesity drug, igniting investor hopes but leaving Wall Street frustrated over a lack of details.】

item.title: 美国结束对特斯拉 Model X 和 S 后视摄像头丢失事件的调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周五表示，已结束对特斯拉约158716辆Model X和Model S汽车后视摄像头丢失问题的工程分析。【原文：The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said on Friday it has closed an engineering analysis opened over the loss of rear-view cameras in about 158,716 Tesla's Model X and Model S vehicles.】

item.title: 多伦多 4 月份房屋销售连续第三个月下降；价格上涨
item.description: 周四的数据显示，大多伦多地区4月份的房屋销售量连续第三个月下降，房价则悄然上涨，原因是超过20年的高利率阻碍了加拿大主要大都会地区房地产市场的复苏。【原文：Greater Toronto area home sales fell in April for a third straight month and prices crept up, as over two-decade high interest rates kept the lid on housing market recovery in Canada's main metropolitan region, data showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 苹果公司旨在讲述没有人工智能账单的人工智能故事
item.description: 在过去一年半的大部分时间里，苹果公司首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）一直在回答华尔街分析师有关其人工智能计划的问题，而外界则抱怨这家 iPhone 制造商没有人工智能方面的故事可讲。【原文：For most of the past year and a half, Apple Chief Executive Tim Cook has fielded questions from Wall Street analysts about his plans for artificial intelligence amid grumbling that the iPhone maker has no AI story to tell.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，索尼和阿波罗提交了价值 260 亿美元的派拉蒙报价
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》报道，索尼影视娱乐公司（SPE）和阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）已向派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）提出 260 亿美元的现金收购要约。【原文：Sony Pictures Entertainment (SPE) and Apollo Global Management have made a $26 billion cash offer for Paramount Global , the Wall Street Journal reported.】

item.title: 德国汉高第一季度业绩强劲，上调2024年展望
item.description: 德国消费品公司汉高（Henkel）周五小幅上调了2024年的业绩指导，称第一季度的强劲表现提升了其销售和盈利前景。【原文：German consumer goods company Henkel slightly raised its guidance for 2024 on Friday, saying strong performance in the first quarter had boosted its sales and earnings outlook.】

item.title: 土耳其通胀率接近 70%，创 2022 年以来新高
item.description: 周五的官方数据显示，土耳其 4 月份的年度消费物价通胀率攀升至 69.8%，略低于预期，但由于教育、餐饮和酒店价格的强劲上涨，通胀率创下了自 2022 年底以来的新高。【原文：Turkish annual consumer price inflation climbed to 69.8% in April, official data showed on Friday, a bit below expectations but the highest since late-2022 on strong rises in education, restaurants and hotels prices.】

item.title: 日本面临与日元熊市的激烈角力
item.description: 分析人士说，日本最近的一系列疑似干预措施似乎为暴跌的日元赢得了一些时间和喘息的机会，但同时也让自己陷入了一场与市场的持久战，因为市场认为日元是一个令人信服的卖点。【原文：Japan appears to have bought some time and respite for a tumbling yen through its latest bursts of suspected interventions, yet it has also set itself up for a protracted war with a market that views the currency as a compelling sell, analysts say.】

item.title: 假日酒店业主国际酒店集团（IHG）公布季度客房收入增长 2.6
item.description: 假日酒店的所有者洲际酒店集团（IHG）周五表示，受日本、澳大利亚、欧洲和中东市场表现的帮助，其第一季度客房收入增长了 2.6%。【原文：Holiday Inn owner Intercontinental Hotels Group (IHG) said on Friday its first-quarter room revenue rose 2.6%, helped by performance in Japan, Australia, Europe and the Middle East.】

item.title: 谷歌为应用商店辩护，反对 Epic Games 要求进行重大改革
item.description: 在两家公司备受关注的反垄断之争中，谷歌要求美国法官不要对 Alphabet 旗下的应用程序商店 Play 实施《堡垒之夜》制造商 Epic Games 提出的全面修改。【原文：Google has asked a U.S. judge not to impose sweeping changes to the Alphabet unit's app store Play that were proposed by "Fortnite" maker Epic Games in the companies' closely-watched antitrust fight.】

item.title: 重油短缺导致托运人和公路建设者成本增加
item.description: 墨西哥的出口削减和加拿大产量的改变方向，正在使大西洋盆地本已有限的重质原油供应缩减，推高了炼油厂的成本，并可能对从航运、建筑到中东电厂等行业产生连锁反应。【原文：Mexican export cuts and a rerouting of Canadian output are shrinking already limited supplies of heavy crude in the Atlantic basin, driving up refiners' costs with a likely knock-on effect to industries ranging from shipping and construction to Middle Eastern power plants.】

item.title: 人工智能蓬勃发展，投资者涌入台湾 ETF，令一些人感到不安
item.description: 随着投资者争相涉足人工智能供应链，资金正源源不断地涌入台湾交易所交易基金，这引起了分析师和监管机构的警惕，正值该行业的涨势变得善变和动荡之际。【原文：Money is pouring into Taiwan exchange-traded funds as investors scramble for exposure to the artificial intelligence supply chain, raising analyst and regulator caution just as a rally in the sector has turned fickle and volatile.】

item.title: 北美市场推动戴姆勒卡车核心利润增长
item.description: 周五，德国戴姆勒卡车公司公布第一季度核心利润为 12.1 亿欧元（13.0 亿美元），高于公司民意调查中一致预期的 11.7 亿欧元，这主要得益于北美卡车业务的强劲表现。【原文：Germany's Daimler Truck AG posted first-quarter core profit of 1.21 billion euros ($1.30 billion) on Friday, beating the consensus estimate of 1.17 billion euros in a company poll, driven by a strong performance of its Trucks North America business.】

item.title: 独家报道：Uniper 休眠的俄罗斯天然气合同可能成为上市障碍
item.description: 三位熟知内情的人士称，欧洲能源危机的最大受害企业 Uniper 正在寻求法院解决其休眠的俄罗斯天然气供应合同问题，一旦该公司完全重返股市，投资者可能会望而却步。【原文：Uniper, the biggest corporate victim of Europe's energy crisis, is looking to the courts to solve the issue of its dormant Russian gas supply contracts that could deter investors once it fully returns to the stock market, three people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 聚焦：阿迪达斯谋划扭转桑巴低迷局面
item.description: 阿迪达斯希望借助白黑三条纹 Samba 和多色 Gazelle 运动鞋的热销，同时也在采取措施，防止这些鞋款成为自身成功的牺牲品。【原文：As Adidas aims to build on hot demand for its three-striped white and black Samba and multi-coloured Gazelle sneakers, it's also taking steps to prevent the shoes from becoming victims of their own success.】

item.title: 法国农业信贷银行第一季度盈利大增，投资银行业务优于竞争对手
item.description: 周五，法国第二大上市银行法国农业信贷银行（Credit Agricole SA）公布的第一季度净利润大幅增长 55%，高于预期，主要得益于企业和投资银行业务的销售表现优于竞争对手。【原文：Credit Agricole SA , France's second-biggest listed bank, posted a forecast-beating 55% jump in first-quarter net profit on Friday, helped by corporate and investment banking sales that outperformed rivals.】

item.title: 早间竞价日元疯狂一周令熊市警惕
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天：【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee:】

item.title: 法国兴业银行投资银行限制第一季度利润暴跌
item.description: 法国兴业银行周五公布的第一季度净利润下滑 22%，好于预期，原因是股票衍生品销售利润抵消了其零售银行和固定收益交易的疲软。【原文：French bank Societe Generale reported a better-than-expected 22% slide in first-quarter net income on Friday, as profits on equity derivative sales offset more weakness at its retail bank and in fixed-income trading.】
